reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Domus Ciliota in October and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is spotless and the location close to the Accademia Bridge is very convenient for exploring the unique city with its canals. Piazza San Marco is an easy ten minute stroll from the hotel. Our room was a nice size, a bit bigger than most European hotel rooms, and a very nice breakfast was served in their large dining room next to the outdoor, garden courtyard. They offer free WiFi throughout the hotel. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly with tips on restaurants and boats. We dined two evenings at the nearby Taverna San Trovaso and enjoyed delicious dinners at a very reasonable price. We would definitely stay at Domus Ciliota on a future trip and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: A Great Place in Venice

reviews.text: This is a very nice small hotel on a side street near Campo San Stefano. To reach it take the water bus to San Samuele and from there it is about a three minute walk. Before going contact the hotel for directions. The rooms are comfortable, very clean, with modern bathrooms. The staff speaks English, French, German, and of course Italian. They were all very helpful and friendly. The location is excellent near St. Marks Square, the Rialto and more shopping than one could manage. It is very good value for Venice.
reviews.title: Domus Ciliota

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for only 1 night. The room was very small but very clean. We did not have a fridge. We stayed in Oct. & the room was very warm so we turned on the air conditioning and went out to supper. When we came back 3 hours later the heat was worse than when we left. My husband went to the front desk to inquire. Apparently the air conditioning had been turned off for the year, and when you turn it on you get heat. They didn't have a fan , so we had to sleep withe window open, which had no screen, yes , we had flies buzzing during the night. But we didn't get any pigeons in our room, that was my big worry. Overall , the room was sparse but it was an old monastery . The breakfast was ok, the staff was friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a tight budget, I prefer a little more space & pampering , but you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Clean room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good price for its location. Rooms are a bit spartan but clean & tidy, if you want to spend a lot of time in the hotel, why come to Venice. Super location, easily accessible from San Samuele vaporetto (no bridges). There was a fridge in the room, which is great not only for cool drinks but for looking after the insulin if you are diabetic. Breakfast was better than most in Venice & more than adequate. 10/15 minutes from San Marco, near to Academia. Have been to Venice many times. This is without doubt the best value place for us will we go back to it?? Yes please!!
reviews.title: Great value & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very good price, friendly knowledgeable staff who replied to emails quickly and gave us the quiet room overlooking the courtyard that we asked for. clean and comfortable, with a decent sized bathroom. quite easy to find if you get off the vaporetto at San Samuele - only 5 minutes to hotel - once you know the shortcuts! first time might take 10 minutes but no bridges to cross. 15 minutes to san marco with lots of interesting shops to pass on the way, including the designer shops, if you have the budget, and also of course lots of restaurants. great for us was a fridge in the room - for a cool drink thro the very hot nights when we were there, even with aircon on. as ever, shop carefully for everything in Venice including when dining and you won't find it as expensive as you might think - and it's a magical city - enjoy!
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 days as part of a driving tour of Italy with 2 nephews. The hotel is well situated if difficult to find on a first visit. It is clean and tidy and the rooms are adequate with fairly comfortable mattresses. TV is all foreign with just a couple of news channels. Wifi is good but patchy. Breakfast uninspired and some of the cereals tasted a bit stale. Only one type of milk as usual. No hot items. The staff were very polite and well informed.
reviews.title: A good hotel - some small failings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Venice is so different to what we are used to, Plane in, Bus to Piazzale Roma then ferry to Accademia,(bought a 72 hr Vapporetto pass) we bumped our bags over the bridge, accross the cobblestones of the Campo st Stefano turn left and left again into a small alleyway to the small entrance of the Hotel. The lovely lady at reception gave us all the info we needed and suggested a great out of the way resturant (San trovaso) as it was 8.30pm when we arrived.
reviews.title: Good Location, Good aircon, good bed & good bathroom is all you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We take the small lift to 2nd floor and walk down to the end of the "hospital" feeling corridor, but the room was clean, tidy and fairly modern basic decor, shower was a bit small but fair size bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the Aircon worked well and was fairly quiet (35degC outside temps).
reviews.title: Check the rooms before you enter!

reviews.text: We had our continential breakfast (price included) out in the central courtyard under umbrellas amongst the relaxing garden, great way to start our day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about halfway between the Piazza San Marco (nice easy walk over canals & thru shopping alleys) and the Rialto Bridge area (crammed full of tourists...keep away from there!).
reviews.title: Looking for somewhere well located for a few days in Venice. This could be it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This simple hotel was very clean and quiet. The staff were very helpful, and the continental breakfast was sufficient. The walk to St Marks square is only about 10 minutes, which is perfect as the hotel is actually in a really quiet area with a few nice restaurants to eat at without the masses to contend with. The best thing though was the price! Far better value than any other hotel in the San Marco district that I could find.
reviews.title: Just the right distance from Piazza San Marco..

reviews.text: A recent trip to Venice was highlighted by a delightful stay at Domus Ciliota. I found the hotel to be exceptionally clean, quiet, and well situated on a quiet street (in San Samuele area, a few minutes walk to St. Mark's Sq.). The DORMITORY-STYLE ROOMS were clean, functional and comfortable. A delicious breakfast was included in the price. There was an elevator to arrive at my top-floor room after my weary legs had walked all over Venice. The front-desk staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. A computer was available in the lobby for guest use. I will definitely use this hotel on a future trip.
reviews.title: A fair hotel rate in Venice

reviews.text: I stayed at this quite basic but good value for money hotel five nights. The location is great because you can walk from the nearest vaporetto station to the hotel without crossing any bridges. This is convinien when wth heavy luggage. The room was quiet and it provided good quality sleep.Tthe breakfast was also good and it gave enough energy till late lunch.
reviews.title: Basic hotel with a good location

reviews.text: I stayed at Ciliota several times. Rooms are quite basic but clean and warm. Fridge in the room was useful. The staff are very helpful. Breakfast could be better: the milk in the machines is long life and the juice is not great but brioches and pastries good. Location is perfect: so close to St Mark Square, Accademia, Rialto. Overall very good value.
reviews.title: Good value and excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, Had always wanted to visit Vwnice/Venezia, but the opportunity had never arisen. So en-route from Carry Le Rouet to Sibenik we were passing so close it seemed ridiculous not to visit. Booked into the Domus Ciliota {Online incredible deal £ 136 for double room for 2 nights} hotel 2 minutes walk from St Marco Plaza and wow what a pleasant surprise. Lovely, comfortable, warm room,Great Shower { No What I Mean???} lovely helpful and pleasant,happy staff. Buffet breakfast with all you could wish for!
reviews.title: Venice in Winter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel used to be a monastery, so it has very clean lines and is comfortable but fairly basic. The room was very plain but comfortable and there is a working elevator and wifi is included. The breakfast is very good and the courtyard (where you eat breakfast) is really nice. The hotel is an easy walk to Piazza San Marco.
reviews.title: Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location near San Marco, Rialto and Accademia, nice courtyard for seating relaxing and breakfest, convinient vending machine for drink at good value, clean hotel friendly staff and good value for Venice.
reviews.title: Quite place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable. The window looked at a wall across a tiny alley, but it was quiet and private. The breakfast was plentiful, with many choices of cereal, bread, pastries, and fruits (whole apples, oranges, pears). Since I don't speak Italian, I was relieved that some of the staff spoke English. The hotel is clean and quite. The location is good.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, comfortable, English speaking staff.

reviews.text: They let us store our bags on arrival, but due to the early hour we were unable to check in, so we came back later. Upon check-in the woman at reception (the same woman we first encountered who let us store our bags) asked for our passports and said she'd note what she needed and take our details while we settle into our room. When we came back down no one was at the desk, a different female employee was alerted by a male employee that we were standing there and when she arrived she didn't seem to speak English as well as the first woman and seemed a bit confused by fact that our passports were sitting in our room-key box. I think a step was missed somewhere, because the fact that the woman who took our passports wasn't the one that gave them back to us, seemed to cause some confusion later on and the evening clerk didn't realize we were in our room.
reviews.title: Nice place
Great location, clean hotel
reviews.text: Perhaps the first clerk didn't jot down our information, perhaps it simply didn't get filed in the right spot or entered into the computer. Regardless, in the middle of the night we were awakened by someone opening our room door! We sat up shouting "Hey! Hey!" as light spilled in from the bright hallway. It was a bit unsettling but also it was clearly someone surprised by our presence, as we were surprised by their arrival. I was puzzled because I was sure I locked the door.
